question.questionA: Leaves in whorls of four or more.
Leaves opposite; stipules standing between the leaves.
question.questionB: Leaves alternate or stipules not standing between the leaves.

question.questionA: Flowers in dense heads of small florets surrounded by an involucre of more than two bracts.
question.questionB: Flowers not in dense heads of florets or, if so, bracts two.

question.questionA: Stamens fused together in a ring around the style.
Calyx absent or represented by hairs or scales; ovule one.
question.questionB: Calyx lobes conspicuous, green; ovules numerous.

question.questionA: Corolla lobes longer than tube; ovules numerous.
question.questionB: Corolla lobes much shorter than tube; ovule one.

question.questionA: Anthers stalkless; pollen grains cohering in rounded masses.
question.questionB: Stamens with filaments; pollen grains not cohering.

question.questionA: Shrubs (sometimes small and creeping) or woody climbers.

question.questionB: Flowers unisexual; fruit a fleshy berry.
